intro: Veronica elata, commonly known as the alpine speedwell, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, blue or purple flowers clustered in dense groups, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Veronica elata thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and tundra environments.
